definitions.definition: To fail to hit , catch , grasp , etc.
examples: I fired the gun, but the bullet missed the target.
I tried to kick the ball, but missed .
She tried to grab hold of the end of the rope, but she missed .
The driver swerved and just managed to miss the chicken crossing the road.

definitions.definition: To fail to achieve or attain .
examples: The company missed all its sales targets.

definitions.definition: To fail to experience , attend , partake , take advantage of , etc.
examples: Joe missed the meeting this morning.
I usually watch the Oscars Ceremonies, but I missed it this year.
I'm starving! I missed breakfast this morning.
I only left the queue for a moment and now I've missed my turn.
This offer is too good to miss .
to miss an opportunity, to miss a chance
The car just missed hitting a passer-by.
We missed disaster by the skin of our teeth.

definitions.definition: To become aware of the loss or absence of; to feel the want or need of, sometimes with regret ; to feel sadness at the absence of somebody or something.
examples: I miss you! Come home soon!
I miss going for walks along the beach.
I'm not going to the party, but I don't think I'll be missed .
I had left my wallet at home, but I only missed it when I got to the metro.
to miss the joke

definitions.definition: To fail to notice ; to have a shortcoming of perception ; overlook .
examples: So I'm just going over my early notes, see if I missed anything.

definitions.definition: To be too late to connect with or meet something or someone (a means of transportation , a deadline , etc.).
examples: I missed the plane!
"Is Polly still here?" — "No, sorry, you've just missed her. She left a couple of minutes ago."

definitions.definition: To be wanting ; to lack something that should be present ( see also adjectival missing ).
examples: The car is missing essential features.
This jigsaw is missing several pieces.

definitions.definition: To spare someone of something unwanted or undesirable.
examples: Miss me with that nonsense!

definitions.definition: To fail to help the hand of a player .
examples: Player A: J7. Player B: Q6. Table: 283. The flop missed both players!

definitions.definition: To be absent, deficient, or wanting.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive , physical ) To fail to hit , catch , grasp , etc.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To fail to achieve or attain .
( transitive ) To fail to experience , attend , partake , take advantage of , etc.
( transitive ) To become aware of the loss or absence of; to feel the want or need of, sometimes with regret ; to feel sadness at the absence of somebody or something.
( transitive ) To fail to notice ; to have a shortcoming of perception ; overlook .
( transitive ) To be too late to connect with or meet something or someone (a means of transportation , a deadline , etc.).
( transitive , mostly continuous tenses ) To be wanting ; to lack something that should be present ( see also adjectival missing ).
( transitive , slang ) To spare someone of something unwanted or undesirable.
( poker , said of a card ) To fail to help the hand of a player .
( sports ) To fail to score (a goal).
( intransitive , obsolete ) To go wrong; to err .
( intransitive , obsolete ) To be absent, deficient, or wanting.
